name: NanoMed Therapeutics
founder_names: Dr. Elena Vasquez; Dr. Raj Kumar
founding_story_summary: Founded by nanotechnology researchers to develop targeted drug delivery systems using engineered nanoparticles for cancer treatment and precision medicine applications.
mission_statement: To revolutionize medicine through precision nanotherapeutics that deliver drugs exactly where needed while minimizing side effects and maximizing therapeutic impact.
primary_products: NanoTarget Cancer Therapy; PrecisionDx Diagnostic Nanoparticles; NanoCarrier Drug Delivery Platform
primary_services: Drug formulation development; clinical trial support; regulatory consulting
core_ip_assets: Targeted nanoparticle engineering; biocompatible polymer chemistry; controlled drug release mechanisms
subsidiaries: NanoMed Europe GmbH (Basel); NanoMed Asia Ltd (Singapore)
major_customers: Pfizer; Roche; Johnson & Johnson; Medisafe Health
major_suppliers: BASF (polymer materials); Evonik (specialty chemicals); Borealis CloudWorks (C003) for clinical data analytics
go_to_market_strategy: Pharma partnership model; licensing agreements; direct clinical development collaborations
pricing_model: Licensing fees + milestone payments + royalty sharing on commercialized products
primary_cloud_provider: Borealis CloudWorks (C003) for clinical analytics with AWS for backup
data_stack: Snowflake; Apache Spark; R/Bioconductor; custom pharmacokinetic modeling
security_certifications: ISO 13485; GMP compliance; FDA IND approved; EMA scientific advice
environmental_goals: Carbon-neutral R&D operations by 2030; 90% green chemistry processes; sustainable nanoparticle production
diversity_goals: 50% women in senior scientific positions by 2028; STEM diversity programs; equitable clinical trials
esg_policy_summary: ESG framework emphasizes patient safety, environmental responsibility in nanomaterial production, and inclusive clinical research.
risk_register_top3: 1. Clinical trial failure risk; 2. Regulatory approval uncertainty; 3. Manufacturing scale-up complexity
competitors: Moderna (LNP technology); BioNTech; Selecta Biosciences; Nanobiotix
cash_management_policy: Maintain 12 months liquidity; 40% cash in pharmaceutical sector bonds; clinical milestone tracking
treasury_risk_limits: Daily VaR $1.2M; max pharma partner exposure $10M; currency hedging for international trials
board_committees: Audit; Scientific Advisory; Compensation; Nominating & ESG
